intro: Brachyscome tatei, commonly known as the silver frost daisy, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale blue daisy-like flowers. The plant has silver-gray foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Brachyscome tatei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to tolerate drought conditions. It is also used in native gardens to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
